title: What is the maximum marks in the examination if in the examination Ram got 20% of the maximum marks and failed by 40 marks and Shyam got 240 marks and failed by 10%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let maximum marks be X. Let passing parks by Y. Ram's marks = 20% of X. Shyam's marks = 240. Ram fails with 40 marks, thus Y - 20% of x = 40 ————— eq 1 Shyam Fails with 10% marks, thus Y - 240 = 10% of X ———— eq 2 Now, solving eq 1 & 2, Y - 0.2 X = 40 Y - 0.1 X = 240 Therefore, X = 2000 Thus, Maximum marks are 2000. Passibg marks are 440, Ram's marks are 400 while Shyam's marks are 240.
.2x+40=.1x+240 or .1x=200 or x =2000. So maximum marks is 2000.
